docs.summary: Tabs enable different content to be displayed with the same URL.
description: multiple tabs, each with different content. One tab is shown at a time.

docs.summary: Gets the tab currently displaying in the tabs container element.

examples.title: Get the current tab and its ID

docs.summary: Gets the tabs container element's default tab.

examples.title: Get the default tab and its ID

docs.summary: Gets a list of all the tabs contained in the tabs container element.
description: The list is ordered as the tabs appear in the menu.

examples.title: Get a list of tabs in a tabs container

params.name: tabReference
params.doc: The tab to move to. Either the [`id`]($w.Tab.html#id) of the tab or a [`Tab`]($w.Tab.html) object in the tabs container element.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The tab that the tabs container element changed to.
Rejected - Error message: If no argument was provided or the argument is not a string or an existing tab.

docs.summary: Change the tabs container element's current tab to a specific tab.
description: The `changeTab()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when
the tabs container element finishes moving from the current tab to the tab
referred to by `tabReference`. `tabReference` can be a tab object or
You can retrieve [`Tab`]($w.Tab.html) objects to pass to the
`tabReference` parameter from your tabs container element using the

examples.title: Move to a new state using an id
Move to a new state using a [`State`]($w.State.html) object

extra.description: This example moves to the state that is stored in the `state` variable.

examples.title: Move to a new state and log a message when the move is finished

extra.description: This example demonstrates how to switch back and forth between 2 states. The multi-state box has 2 states, with IDs `state1` and `state2`. Each state has a button. When a site visitor clicks the button, the multi-state box moves to the other state.

examples.title: State per Status
body: // Get all info on the current product
// If the price is different than the discount price, indicating a sale

extra.description: This example demonstrates how to display different product badges for products on a Wix Stores product page. When a site visitor navigates to a product, we check the product's status (out of stock, on sale) and change the state to display the appropriate badge.

params.name: eventHandler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the tabs container element moves to a new tab.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the tabs container element moves to a new tab.
description: `onChange` is fired when the tabs container element moves to a new tab. This occurs
when the [`changeTab()`](#changeTab) function is called or when a visitor clicks on a tab menu item.

examples.title: Get the ID of the tab to which the tabs container element moved

params.name: eventHandler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
the function expression to run when a visitor clicks on a tab menu item.

ret.doc: The tabs container element on which the event is now registered.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when any tab menu item is clicked.
description: `onTabItemClicked` is fired when a visitor clicks on any tab menu item in the tabs container element.

examples.title: Get the ID of the tab clicked

params.name: orderedTabIDs
params.doc: The IDs of the tabs in the desired new order.

docs.summary: Order the `tabs` array to match the order of `orderedTabIDs`.

examples.title: Get the ID of the state to which the multi-state box moved
